comment: Very sweet, but not syrupy. The orange and bitters come through. This is close to an Old Fashion in a bottle, ready to drink.
Slow sipper with a sweet taste
First time with rye, I couldn't get past the alchohol burn to get any flavor, even after 3rd attempt on 3 nights in a row

This sweet and fruity and very unusual rye. The orange rock candy is strong. It is a cocktail in a bottle. Moderate finish for the low proof. Very little rye spice. Buy for the uniqueness and low price.
Sweet and flavorful. A nice departure from just the grains of Scotch, Rye, or Bourbon.

As said in other reviews it’s an old fashioned in a bottle, strong orange and bit of chocolate flavour with a weak rye backbone. It’s all right, crazy first taste if u can settle into the notion of a old fashioned as a straight whiskey it’s alright

Definitely an Old Fashioned in a bottle. If you like orange you’ll love this. The orange rock candy easily comes thru. If you like sweet this fits the bill too. TEHO but for bottles under $30 this is easily a daily drinker.

This is more like a liqueur than a straight whiskey. Strong orange nose like a orange peel. Sweet flavors like grandmas hard candy. Rye is very subdued. This is not what I was expecting but I’ve been pleasantly surprised. It’s a good sipper and a unique bottle to have.
